sponsor.partnerMessage: Since 1957, Underwoods has been committed to quality and value. Named "Coolest Store in America" by InStore Magazine and winner of state, national, and international design awards, Underwoods' dedication to craftsmanship and design excellence creates timeless jewelry.

posts.title: House Cured Culinary Offers Private Chef Services At Home
posts.content:
Experience the joy of hosting a stress-free dinner party with House Cured Culinary, and let Chef Kevin handle everything from shopping to on-site preparation and clean-up so you can enjoy the company of your guests.

  • Customize: Chef Kevin will work with you to create a memorable experience and delicious menu while meeting your budget, whether you're building a customizable 6-course tasting menu or simple family fare. Cost varies depending on the menu and headcount, but prices are comparable to restaurants, often cheaper without the inflated cost of alcohol.
  • Expertise: A graduate of Colorado Mountain College Culinary Institute, Chef Kevin McCombs has over 20 years of experience in the industry, including serving as executive chef of Keystone's Ski Tip restaurant, voted Best Restaurant in Summit County, CO, for many years.

See how it works and reserve your dinner with Chef Kevin HERE.

posts.title: Kids Obstacle Course Race Coming To J.B. Hunt Park
posts.content:
Let the kids loose to run and ninja warrior-climb their way through the Young Lions Obstacle Course NWA 2023 on Saturday, Jun 10, from 9a-1p at JB Hunt Park in Springdale.

  • Challenge accepted: The 1-mi obstacle course will feature ten ninja warrior-style obstacles for kids to complete. Each participant will receive a Young Lions medal and sticker and is welcome to run the course as many times as their legs can carry them!
  • Family fun: Parents are welcome to go through the course with their kids to take pictures and assist as needed, and there will be Kona Ice, inflatables, face paint, balloon art, a food truck, and more for the entire family to enjoy the day together.

Tickets are $30, but use the code NWADAILY for $20 off! Register HERE.

posts.title: Two NWA Teachers Join National Geographic Expedition To Antarctica
posts.content:
Matt Holden, a science teacher at Fayetteville High School, and Brittany Berry, an EAST facilitator at Helen Tyson Middle School in Springdale, have been invited to participate in research expeditions to Antarctica as recipients of the Grosvenor Teacher Fellowship from National Geographic.

  • Explore: The Grosvenor Teacher Fellowship offers educators a life-changing opportunity to experience immersive expeditions, enhance their geographic knowledge, and bring transformative experiences back to their classrooms, such as water samples, photos, videos, and 360 VR recordings.
  • Educate: Holden and Berry will travel by ship via the Drake Passage and join National Geographic researchers on excursions to observe the environment and wildlife. Both educators shared a desire to bring back experiences that foster lifelong curiosity in their students and demonstrate how global environmental issues begin at the local level.

Learn more about the expedition from their interview on Ozarks At Large HERE.

posts.title: Onyx Coffee Labs Relaunches In-Person Classes
posts.content:
Onyx Coffee Lab has announced the return of its in-person coffee classes and will host the first of the Onyx Coffee Academy: Intro To Home Brewing classes at the Onyx Headquarters in Downtown Rogers this Saturday, Jun 10, from 9-11a.

  • Learn from the best: Soon to be featured in the new docuseries The Road To Milan, Onyx Coffee Labs has raised the bar for coffee in the region and earned worldwide attention for its diverse selection of high-quality beans and a commitment to "Never Settle For Good Enough."
  • Brew better: The 2hr course will cover the theory and practical skills needed to prepare better coffee at home, exploring the coffee brewing variables of using auto-drip coffee machines in an engaging class-like setting.

Purchase tickets for Intro To Home Brewing HERE.

posts.title: Eureka Springs Prepares For Ozark Mountain Soul Festival
posts.content:
Opal Agafia‚Äôs Ozark Mountain Soul Fest will bring three days of live music, three nights of camping, and various vendors and activities to The Farm in Eureka Springs from Jun 15-17.

  • The venue: Placing its primary focus on Americana-Roots music, the festival delivers a variety of genres amidst the beautiful Ozark scenery of The Farm, which was awarded Venue of the Year during the Arkansas Country Music Awards earlier this week.
  • The lineup: The weekend features an exciting lineup of local and national talent, including Opal Agafia, The SteelDrivers, Vince Herman Band, and Monk is King. There are ticket options for the entire three days, two days, or Saturday only, and event tickets include camping passes.

See the festival schedule and purchase tickets HERE.
